content.thinking:
Now I have a good understanding of the project. Let me plan what needs to be built:

1. A 6-question quiz with one question per screen
2. Questions: goal, coaching style, feedback style, programming style, check-in frequency, experience
3. Tap to select + auto-advance
4. Mobile-first design
5. Store answers in React state

From the score.ts file, I can see the existing types:
- `Goal`: 'weight_loss' | 'muscle_gain' | 'endurance' | 'flexibility' | 'general_fitness'
- `Style` (coaching/programming style): 'high_intensity' | 'low_impact' | 'strength' | 'cardio' | 'yoga'


- `FeedbackStyle`: 'detailed' | 'brief' | 'motivational' | 'technical'
- `Structure` (programming style): 'strict' | 'flexible' | 'mixed'
- `CheckinFrequency`: 'daily' | 'weekly' | 'biweekly' | 'monthly'

The experience question isn't defined yet, so I'll need to create a simple experience level type for that. The quiz flows through goal, coaching style, feedback style, programming structure, check-in frequency, and experience level.

Looking at the issue more carefully, the existing types in score.ts already cover goal, style, feedback, structure, and checkins—experience is the only new one, and since it's not explicitly requested to be added to score.ts, I'll keep it separate. My approach is to create a feature branch, build the quiz as a client component, and replace the main page with it since that's where the quiz should live. The component will manage state internally and handle navigation after collecting all the answers. directly in the page.

Now I'm mapping out the core structure: I need to track which question we're on and store the user's answers, then display one question at a time with its options. When someone selects an option, it should automatically move to the next question, and once all questions are answered, show a summary or completion state.

For the experience question specifically, I'll use options like beginner, intermediate, and advanced. My approach is to create the Quiz component in `app/components/Quiz.tsx` as a client component, then import it into `app/page.tsx`. The quiz data will start with a fitness goal question offering weight loss, muscle gain, and endurance as choices.

Now I'm laying out all six questions with their respective options: fitness goals, preferred training style, feedback preferences, program structure, check-in frequency, and experience level. I'll need to handle the experience field since it's not in the existing score.ts types, so I'll add it as a new property.

Building the quiz component...

content.text: Now I have a clear picture of the project. Let me create the feature branch and implement the quiz UI.

feat(FRG-124): build 6-question onboarding quiz UI

One question per screen with tap-to-select auto-advance. Mobile-first
design using Tailwind. Answers (goal, style, feedback, structure,
checkins, experience) stored in React state. Shows a summary screen
on completion with a restart option.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"

## Summary
- Adds `app/components/Quiz.tsx` — a `'use client'` component with 6 on-boarding questions (goal, coaching style, feedback style, programming/structure, check-in frequency, experience)
- One question per screen; tapping an option auto-advances to the next
- Progress bar and step counter at the top; summary screen after all 6 answers
- Answers stored in `QuizAnswers` React state using existing types from `src/lib/score.ts`
- Replaces the default Next.js placeholder in `app/page.tsx` with `<Quiz />`

## Test plan
- [x] `npm run build` — compiles cleanly (TypeScript + Turbopack)
- [x] `npm test` — all 10 existing score unit tests pass
- [ ] Manual: open on mobile viewport, tap through all 6 questions, verify auto-advance and summary screen

Closes FRG-124

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)
EOF
)"

input.body:
## Implementation complete

**PR:** https://github.com/chillkimtest-oss/fitmatch/pull/2
**Branch:** `feature/FRG-124-quiz-ui`

### What was built
- `app/components/Quiz.tsx` — `'use client'` component with all 6 questions, one per screen
- Tap-to-select auto-advances to the next question immediately (no separate "Next" button)
- Progress bar + step counter (`1 / 6`, `2 / 6`, …) at the top
- Answers stored in `QuizAnswers` React state using existing types from `src/lib/score.ts` (`Goal`, `Style`, `FeedbackStyle`, `Structure`, `CheckinFrequency`) plus a new `Experience` type (`beginner | intermediate | advanced`) for question 6
- Summary screen at the end shows all chosen answers with a "Start over" button
- `app/page.tsx` updated to render `<Quiz />`

### Decisions
- Experience options (`beginner | intermediate | advanced`) are stored in state but not yet wired into the scoring logic — that can be added in a follow-up when the scorer is updated
- Mobile-first layout: full-screen per question, large tap targets (rounded-2xl buttons), minimal chrome

content.text:
## Status
DONE

## What Changed
- `app/components/Quiz.tsx` — new `'use client'` component: 6-question quiz, one screen per question, tap-to-select auto-advance, progress bar, summary screen, answers in `QuizAnswers` React state
- `app/page.tsx` — replaced Next.js placeholder with `<Quiz />`
- `app/layout.tsx` — updated metadata title/description to "FitMatch"

## Key Decisions
- Added `Experience = 'beginner' | 'intermediate' | 'advanced'` as the 6th question type; it's stored in state but deliberately not wired into `score.ts` yet (scorer doesn't have that field)
- Auto-advance fires immediately on tap — no separate "Next" button, matching the issue spec

## PR / Branch
- Branch: `feature/FRG-124-quiz-ui`
- PR: https://github.com/chillkimtest-oss/fitmatch/pull/2

- `app/page.tsx` — replaced Next.js placeholder with `<Quiz />`
- `app/layout.tsx` — updated metadata title/description to "FitMatch"

## Key Decisions
- Added `Experience = 'beginner' | 'intermediate' | 'advanced'` as the 6th question type; it's stored in state but deliberately not wired into `score.ts` yet (scorer doesn't have that field)
